1.name: Player Piano
1.description: Vonnegut’s vision of an America restructured by industrial technocrats whose robotics in the workplace result in a devaluing of human participation.
1.author: K. Vonnegut

2.name: The Sirens of Titan
2.description: The premise of the novel is that all of human history has been one big Rube Goldberg invention by the Tralfamadorians for the single purpose of getting a spare part to their stranded but intrepid intergalactic messenger, Salo
2.author: K. Vonnegut

3.name: Mother Night
3.description: The closest Vonnegut gets to “Nazi monkey business” until letting go in Slaughterhouse-Five.
3.author: K. Vonnegut
